verses.roman:
mṛga-mṛgī mukha dekhi' prabhu-aṅga cāṭe
bhaya nāhi kare, saṅge yāya vāṭe-vāṭe

synonyms: mṛga-mṛgī—the deer, both male and female; mukha dekhi'-seeing His face; prabhu-aṅga cāṭe—began to lick the body of the Lord; bhaya nāhi kare—they were not at all afraid; saṅge yāya—go with Him; vāṭe-vāṭe—all along the road.
translation: When the does and bucks came and saw the Lord's face, they began to lick His body. Not being at all afraid of Him, they accompanied Him along the path.
